titleStmt.title: A certaine relation of the earle of Ormonds proseedings in Ireland, shewing what prisoners he hath taken, and what townes he hath burnt and what store of pillage he hath sent, and brought home with him. Also the manner of the enemies besieging Bandonbridge, with 12000. men, and how that there were slaine 2000. of them, the rest put to flight by the earle of Corke sonnes and Sir Charles Vauersour. Being a letter sent from Sir Robert Trevers to Sir. william Dike, living in theamestreet in London. Iune 3. Ordered to bee forthwith printed.
titleStmt.author: Travers, Robert, Sir.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
